intro: Acacia sulcata var. platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaf acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing drought tolerance and adaptability to poor soils. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for landscaping purposes.
